results.title: The World of David Milne
results.creator_credit: Gerald Budner, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively, exciting experience of art, from the words and paintings of David Milne. “Art”, he said, “isn’t a fire in the grass; it’s an explosion.” Milne’s letters read as a commentary, tell how he felt about what he painted, how he tried to catch the essence of his feelings “before the power ran out…like escaping steam”. We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Budner, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The World of Andrew Wyeth
results.creator_credit: Al Schwartz, Hal Wallace and A Schwartz-Wallace Production
results.brief_description: An examination of the work of American painter Andrew Wyeth. Over thirty-five paintings are shown. Blending the subjects of the artist’s representational style painting with actual scenes from the Pennsylvania and Maine countryside. The artist’s special vision and technique make the lonely countryside, and gnarled people uniquely his.

results.title: The World Is Watching
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Jim Monro, Harold Crooks, Great Britain, Ikon TV, Holland, Sveriges TV, Sweden, Channel 4 Television Corporation, TV Ontario and Investigative Productions Inc
results.brief_description: Cameraman Don Holmberg and award-winning independent Canadian director, Peter Raymont, covered peace talks in Nicaragua, November 1987. What they saw, and what was reported on television networks in the US and Europe was quite different.

results.title: The World is round. - [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about an organization called Canada World Youth, which brings together young people from Canada and developing countries in Latin America, Asia and Africa. They live and work in an atmosphere of international fellowship and understanding. An NFB camera crew circled the globe, filming the program in Canada, Guatemala, Senegal, and Malaysia. The film tells of the rich and colorful experiences of the participants in this unique experience.

results.title: Welcome to Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film starts with Darren McCubbin, the Mayor of the Wellington Shire, welcoming the audience to Maffra. Darren explains that we are about to visit some of the places and meet some of the people that make Maffra a unique place to live. The film features the Geoff Webster Centre, the Gippsland Vehicle Collection, the Maffra Gymnastics Club, the George Gray Centre, Wallaby Rise Restaurant, Cambrai Backpacker Hostel and Jenny McDavitt an Alpaca farmer and Ferial Zikerman who is now internationally known for her Maffra Cheese.

results.title: Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This film focuses on the young people of Maffra. Eight students from Maffra Secondary College were interviewed, representing all the year levels, and asked to talk about life in a regional town, their hopes for the future and issues that affect them and their world.
The end result is a portrait of young rural Victorians who are thoughtful and engaging, with concerns about the environment, world politics and the survival of small towns.
